info.name: 3CX Configuration API
info.description:
The 3CX Configuration API is a powerful API that allows to manage every aspect of your 3CX Phone System programmatically.

As a first step please go in 3CX Configuration API / Variables and set the PBX_FQDN variable to your FQDN:HTTS_PORT.

Then go to Authentication Overview tab to learn how to authenticate.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Gets information about the authenticated user.

item.description:
The `/connect/` endpoint allows to authenticate via the API key as Multi-Company Admin whilst the `/webclient/api/` allows to authenticate under a given user.

**Multi-Company Admin**

- First, you need to setup your 3CX Phone System in Multi Company mode - refer to our website documentation on this. Then log in your webclient as System Owner and go Admin Console / System / Multi Company, click Generate token.
    
- Copy that token and paste it in 3CX Configuration API / Variables / API_TOKEN.
    
- Run the "Mutli-Company Admin authentication" request. When successful this will issue an Access token.
    
- Copy the Access token from the response and paste it in 3CX Configuration API / Variables / ACCESS_TOKEN and Save to run subsequent API requests.
    

**User**

- First, go in your 3CX Phone System / Admin Console / Users,
    
- Create a user of any preferred role, e.g System Owner, ensure the "Enable 2FA" option unticked and a preferred email address.
    
- Reset password for this user via the welcome email reset link that was just sent.
    
- Input the user extension number in 3CX Configuration API / Variables / USER_NUM and the webclient password in USER_PASS and Save.
    
- Run the "User authentication" request. When successful this will issue an Access token.
    
- Copy the Access token from the response and paste it in 3CX Configuration API / Variables / ACCESS_TOKEN and Save to run subsequent API requests.
    

Note the ACCESS_TOKEN expires after 1 hour so you will need to re-authenticate programatically every 1 hour or if getting a 401 response.

item.name: Create 3CX Live Chat Url for a Department

body.raw:
{
    "Advanced": {
        "CallTitle": "",
        "CommunicationOptions": "PhoneAndChat",
        "EnableDirectCall": true,
        "IgnoreQueueOwnership": false
    },
    "CallsEnabled": true,
    "ChatBox": {
        "ButtonIconType": "Default",
        "ButtonIconUrl": "",
        "ChatDelay": 2000,
        "Height": "28.5vh",
        "LiveChatLanguage": "browser",
        "LiveMessageUserinfoFormat": "Both",
        "MessageDateformat": "Both",
        "MinimizedStyle": "BottomRight",
        "OperatorIcon": "",
        "OperatorName": "",
        "ShowOperatorActualName": true,
        "WindowIcon": ""

    "DefaultRecord": true,

}
